what: Demographics and socio-economic indicators from the 2022 ACS — acs
title: Demographics and socio-economic indicators from the 2022 ACS — acs
text: dataset containing indicators US Census Bureau's 2022 American Community Survey 5-year estimates. given several geographic levels, including US, every metropolitan statistical area (MSA) country, state Maryland, every county census tract Maryland.

title: Demographics and socio-economic indicators from the 2022 ACS — acs
Demographics and socio-economic indicators from the 2022 ACS — acs
text: data frame 1870 rows 30 variables: level Factor. Geographic level (us, msa, state, county, tract). county Character. Name county tracts, NA otherwise. name Character. name geography, including FIPS codes tracts. total_pop Numeric. Total population. white Numeric. Share population White. black Numeric. Share population Black. latino Numeric. Share population Latino. asian Numeric. Share population Asian. other_race Numeric. Share population race. diversity_idx Numeric. Diversity index based preceding race/ethnicity columns. Uses Theil's H entropy. foreign_born Numeric. Share population foreign born. total_hh Numeric. Total households. homeownership Numeric. Homeownership rate. total_cost_burden Numeric. Share households cost burdened, based HUD's standard housing costs 30% household's total income. total_severe_cost_burden Numeric. Share households severely cost burdened, paying 50% income toward housing costs. owner_cost_burden Numeric. Share homeowners cost burdened. owner_severe_cost_burden Numeric. Share homeowners severely cost burdened. renter_cost_burden Numeric. Share renters cost burdened. renter_severe_cost_burden Numeric. Share renters severely cost burdened no_vehicle_hh Numeric. Share households without vehicle. median_hh_income Numeric. Median household income 2022 dollars. ages25plus Numeric. Population aged 25 . less_than_high_school Numeric. Share population aged 25 less high school diploma. high_school_grad Numeric. Share population aged 25 high school diploma. some_college_or_aa Numeric. Share population aged 25 college associate degree. bachelors Numeric. Share population aged 25 bachelor's degree. grad_degree Numeric. Share population aged 25 graduate degree. pov_status_determined Numeric. Population poverty status determined. poverty Numeric. Poverty rate, share population poverty status determined lives household income federal poverty level. low_income Numeric. Low-income rate, share population poverty status determined lives household income 2 times federal poverty level.

title: Demographics and socio-economic indicators from the 2022 ACS — acs
text: Calculated US Census Bureau. American Community Survey 2022 5-year estimates. Calculated Camille tidycensus cwi packages.

title: Demographics and socio-economic indicators from the 2022 ACS — acs
code: head(acs) #> # A tibble: 6 × 30 #>   level county name  total_pop white black latino asian other_race diversity_idx #>   <fct> <chr>  <chr>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>      <dbl>         <dbl> #> 1 us    NA     Unit… 331097593  0.59  0.12   0.19  0.06       0.05         0.744 #> 2 msa   NA     Abil…    176656  0.63  0.07   0.25  0.02       0.03         0.626 #> 3 msa   NA     Akro…    700578  0.78  0.12   0.02  0.03       0.05         0.486 #> 4 msa   NA     Alba…    147716  0.41  0.52   0.03  0.01       0.03         0.598 #> 5 msa   NA     Alba…    128598  0.83  0      0.1   0.01       0.06         0.433 #> 6 msa   NA     Alba…    901729  0.77  0.07   0.06  0.05       0.05         0.532 #> # ℹ 20 more variables: foreign_born <dbl>, total_hh <dbl>, homeownership <dbl>, #> #   total_cost_burden <dbl>, total_severe_cost_burden <dbl>, #> #   owner_cost_burden <dbl>, owner_severe_cost_burden <dbl>, #> #   renter_cost_burden <dbl>, renter_severe_cost_burden <dbl>, #> #   no_vehicle_hh <dbl>, median_hh_income <dbl>, ages25plus <dbl>, #> #   less_than_high_school <dbl>, high_school_grad <dbl>, #> #   some_college_or_aa <dbl>, bachelors <dbl>, grad_degree <dbl>, …

what: Adult health data from the CDC — cdc
title: Adult health data from the CDC — cdc
text: dataset containing health indicators CDC's PLACES project US, Maryland, state's counties census tracts. tract-level data directly measured, values modeled. recent data 2023 update. denominator variables population adults ages 18 older, except missing health insurance, based adults ages 18 64.

title: Adult health data from the CDC — cdc
Adult health data from the CDC — cdc
text: data frame 14140 rows 6 variables: level Factor. level data (us, state, etc.). year Character. year data collected. location Character. location data collected (US, Maryland, etc.). indicator Character. health indicator measured. value Numeric. rate corresponding population. pop Numeric. adult population size given location year, used denominator.

title: Adult health data from the CDC — cdc
text: Centers Disease Control Prevention (CDC) PLACES Project. Data portal, definitions, methodology available https://www.cdc.gov/places/

title: Adult health data from the CDC — cdc
code: head(cdc) #> # A tibble: 6 × 6 #>   level year  location indicator            value       pop #>   <fct> <chr> <chr>    <chr>                <dbl>     <dbl> #> 1 us    2021  US       Health insurance      10.8 331893745 #> 2 us    2021  US       Cancer (except skin)   7   331893745 #> 3 us    2021  US       Mental health         14.7 331893745 #> 4 us    2021  US       Diabetes              11.3 331893745 #> 5 us    2020  US       Dental visit          64.8 331893745 #> 6 us    2021  US       Current asthma         9.7 331893745

title: EPA environmental justice index — ejscreen
text: dataset containing environmental health risk factors EPA's EJSCREEN environment justice index census tracts Maryland. Values calculated based aggregations risk factors, given nationwide percentiles. Columns starting "d" adjusted one two different definitions vulnerable populations.

title: EPA environmental justice index — ejscreen
text: data frame 19175 rows 5 variables: tract Character. tract FIPS code. indicator Factor. environmental health risk factor, proximity water treatment air pollution-related cancers. value_ptile Integer. nationwide percentile indexed values. d2_ptile Integer. percentile indexed values scaled based two-factor demographic index (percent low-income percent people color). d5_ptile Integer. percentile indexed values scaled based five-factor demographic index (percent low-income, unemployment rate, percent limited English, percent without high school diploma, low life expectancy).

title: EPA environmental justice index — ejscreen
text: Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) EJSCREEN Environment Justice Index. Data portal, definitions, methodology available https://www.epa.gov/ejscreen/technical-information--ejscreen

title: EPA environmental justice index — ejscreen
code: head(ejscreen) #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>   tract       indicator       value_ptile d2_ptile d5_ptile #>   <chr>       <fct>                 <int>    <int>    <int> #> 1 24001000100 pm25                      6        7        9 #> 2 24001000100 ozone                     0        0        0 #> 3 24001000100 diesel                    3        5        5 #> 4 24001000100 air_cancer                0        0        0 #> 5 24001000100 resp                      0        0        0 #> 6 24001000100 releases_to_air          65       44       73

title: Shapefile of highways — highways_sf
text: sf object containing highways (specifically keyed motorways trunks) Baltimore city surrounding counties OpenStreetMap.

title: Shapefile of highways — highways_sf
text: sf data frame 7540 rows 4 variables: osm_id Character. OpenStreetMap ID highway; can used retrieve metadata. name Character. name highway, labeled OSM database. lanes Numeric. number lanes highway. geometry LINESTRING. geometric representation highway.

title: Shapefile of highways — highways_sf
text: OpenStreetMap database via osmdata package.

what: Quickly cut a vector with the Jenks/Fisher algorithms — jenks
title: Quickly cut a vector with the Jenks/Fisher algorithms — jenks
text: Given numeric vector, returns factor values cut n number breaks using Jenks/Fisher algorithms. algorithm(s) sets breaks way highlights high low values well. good use choropleths need convey imbalances inequities.

title: Quickly cut a vector with the Jenks/Fisher algorithms — jenks
code: jenks(x, n = 5, true_jenks = FALSE, labels = NULL, ...)

title: Quickly cut a vector with the Jenks/Fisher algorithms — jenks
text: x numeric vector cut n Number bins, Default: 5 true_jenks Logical: "true" Jenks algorithm used? false, uses faster Fisher-Jenks algorithm. See classInt::classIntervals docs discussion. Default: FALSE labels string vector used bin labels, Default: NULL ... Additional arguments passed base::cut

title: Quickly cut a vector with the Jenks/Fisher algorithms — jenks
text: factor length x

title: Quickly cut a vector with the Jenks/Fisher algorithms — jenks
Police stops in Connecticut — police_stops
text: dataset containing responses questions unfair treatment police 2021 DataHaven Community Wellbeing Survey. data broken location, category, group, values adults Connecticut, New Haven, Greater New Haven area.

title: Police stops in Connecticut — police_stops
text: data frame 13 rows 5 variables: name Character. name location data collected. category Factor. Category data aggregated (total, gender, race/ethnicity). group Factor. group within given category data aggregated (Total, Male, Female, White, Black, Latino). ever_unfairly_stopped Numeric. share respondents reported ever unfairly stopped, harassed, abused police. multiple_times_3yr Numeric. share respondents reported treatment happened multiple times past 3 years.

title: Police stops in Connecticut — police_stops
text: DataHaven Community Wellbeing Survey 2021, analyzed Camille's packages cwi dcws (currently public). https://ctdatahaven.org/reports/datahaven-community-wellbeing-survey

title: Police stops in Connecticut — police_stops
code: head(police_stops) #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>   name        category       group  ever_unfairly_stopped multiple_times_3yr #>   <chr>       <fct>          <fct>                  <dbl>              <dbl> #> 1 Connecticut Total          Total                   0.15              0.293 #> 2 Connecticut Gender         Male                    0.2               0.27  #> 3 Connecticut Gender         Female                  0.11              0.354 #> 4 Connecticut Race/Ethnicity White                   0.12              0.162 #> 5 Connecticut Race/Ethnicity Black                   0.25              0.4   #> 6 Connecticut Race/Ethnicity Latino                  0.2               0.5

what: Round a set of numbers so they'll add up to 100 — round_sum100
title: Round a set of numbers so they'll add up to 100 — round_sum100
text: function takes vector numbers rounds coerce add 100. works best numbers several decimal places close adding 100. definitely fool-proof, can help situations like waffle charts previous rounding may make numbers add exactly 100.

title: Round a set of numbers so they'll add up to 100 — round_sum100
Round a set of numbers so they'll add up to 100 — round_sum100
text: x numeric vector digits Number digits use rounding; probably need change . Default: 0 verbose Logical; TRUE, print sum, letting confirm whether numbers indeed add 100. Defaults FALSE.

title: Round a set of numbers so they'll add up to 100 — round_sum100
text: numeric vector hopefully adds 100.

title: Round a set of numbers so they'll add up to 100 — round_sum100
Average annual consumer spending — spending
text: dataset containing mean amounts money spent different categories goods year, broken US household income quintile. data comes US Census Bureau's annual Consumer Expenditure Survey. Dollar amounts given year reported, adjusted inflation.

title: Average annual consumer spending — spending
text: data frame 202 rows 12 variables: year Numeric. year survey. item Character. category goods. qtotal Numeric. mean amount spent item households. q1 Numeric. mean amount spent item households first (lowest) income quintile. q2 Numeric. mean amount spent item households second income quintile. q3 Numeric. mean amount spent item households third income quintile. q4 Numeric. mean amount spent item households fourth income quintile. q5 Numeric. mean amount spent item households fifth (highest) income quintile. l2 Character. second level category item. NA applicable. l3 Character. third level category item. NA applicable. l4 Character. fourth level category item. NA applicable. l5 Character. fifth level category item. NA applicable.

title: Average annual consumer spending — spending
text: US Census Bureau's Consumer Expenditure Survey, available Bureau Labor Statistics https://www.bls.gov/cex/data.htm

title: Average annual consumer spending — spending
code: head(spending) #> # A tibble: 6 × 12 #>    year item       qtotal    q1    q2    q3    q4     q5 l2    l3    l4    l5    #>   <dbl> <chr>       <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> #> 1  2019 Average a…  63036 28672 40472 53045 71173 121571 NA    NA    NA    NA    #> 2  2019 Food         8169  4400  5859  7505  9080  13987 Food  NA    NA    NA    #> 3  2019 Food at h…   4643  2790  3672  4422  5198   7129 Food  Food… NA    NA    #> 4  2019 Cereals a…    583   373   466   549   660    867 Food  Food… Cere… NA    #> 5  2019 Cereals a…    184   105   142   175   206    289 Food  Food… Cere… Cere… #> 6  2019 Bakery pr…    400   268   324   374   454    578 Food  Food… Cere… Bake…

what: Census tracts for the Baltimore area — tracts_sf
title: Census tracts for the Baltimore area — tracts_sf
text: dataset containing 2020 census tract boundaries Baltimore surrounding counties. data comes tigris package geometries simplified.

title: Census tracts for the Baltimore area — tracts_sf
Census tracts for the Baltimore area — tracts_sf
text: sf data frame 606 rows 3 variables: county Character. name county census tract located. geoid Character. FIPS code census tract. geometry POLYGON. geometric representation census tract boundary.

title: Census tracts for the Baltimore area — tracts_sf
text: U.S. Census Bureau, TIGER boundary files via tigris package

title: Census tracts for the Baltimore area — tracts_sf
Monthly unemployment rates — unemployment
text: dataset containing monthly unemployment rates 2000 2023 Maryland, Baltimore city, surrounding counties. data comes Bureau Labor Statistics' Local Area Unemployment Statistics (LAUS).

title: Monthly unemployment rates — unemployment
text: data frame 1436 rows 4 variables: name Character. name location. date Date. month unemployment reported. reported_rate Numeric. reported unemployment rate. adjusted_rate Numeric. seasonally adjusted unemployment rate.

title: Monthly unemployment rates — unemployment
text: U.S. Bureau Labor Statistics, Local Area Unemployment Statistics via API cwi package. https://www.bls.gov/lau/ Seasonal adjustment done BLS' methodology via feasts::X_13ARIMA_SEATS.

title: Monthly unemployment rates — unemployment
code: head(unemployment) #> # A tibble: 6 × 4 #>   name                date       reported_rate adjusted_rate #>   <chr>               <date>             <dbl>         <dbl> #> 1 Anne Arundel County 2000-01-01           3            2.81 #> 2 Anne Arundel County 2000-02-01           3.1          2.90 #> 3 Anne Arundel County 2000-03-01           2.9          2.90 #> 4 Anne Arundel County 2000-04-01           2.6          2.93 #> 5 Anne Arundel County 2000-05-01           3.1          3.20 #> 6 Anne Arundel County 2000-06-01           3.4          3.01

what: Vacancy rates and correlated housing measures — vacant
title: Vacancy rates and correlated housing measures — vacant
text: dataset containing vacancy rates values related housing tracts Baltimore; Stamford, CT; New Haven, CT. data comes 2022 American Community Survey (ACS).

title: Vacancy rates and correlated housing measures — vacant
Vacancy rates and correlated housing measures — vacant
text: data frame 264 rows 11 variables: state Character. state FIPS code. city Character. city name. county Character. 3-digit county FIPS code. geoid Character. tract FIPS code. total_units Numeric. total number housing units. vacants Numeric. number vacant housing units. med_rent Numeric. median rent renter-occupied housing units. med_housing_value Numeric. median housing value owner-occupied housing units. vacancy_rate Numeric. vacancy rate. area_sqmi Numeric. area square miles. housing_density Numeric. housing density (total units per square mile).

title: Vacancy rates and correlated housing measures — vacant
text: Calculated US Census Bureau. American Community Survey 2022 5-year estimates. Calculated Camille tidycensus cwi packages.

title: Vacancy rates and correlated housing measures — vacant
code: head(vacant) #> # A tibble: 6 × 11 #>   state city     county geoid     total_units vacants med_rent med_housing_value #>   <chr> <chr>    <chr>  <chr>           <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>             <dbl> #> 1 09    Stamford 190    09190021…        2545     198     2009            555600 #> 2 09    Stamford 190    09190021…        1230      58     1922            416700 #> 3 09    Stamford 190    09190020…        2317     113     1965            472100 #> 4 09    Stamford 190    09190021…        2193     169     1924            366800 #> 5 09    Stamford 190    09190021…        2494     243     2400            300000 #> 6 09    Stamford 190    09190021…        1192       0     1463            377300 #> # ℹ 3 more variables: vacancy_rate <dbl>, area_sqmi <dbl>, #> #   housing_density <dbl>

title: Median wages by demographic — wages
text: dataset containing median individual earnings various dimensions (education, occupation, etc.) US Maryland, adults ages 25 positive earnings. data calculated 2022 American Community Survey (ACS) Public Use Microdata Sample (PUMS) data via Integrated Public Use Microdata Series (IPUMS).

title: Median wages by demographic — wages
text: data frame 309 rows 15 variables: dimension Factor. dimension across values calculated. name Factor. name region (US Maryland). sex Factor. sex individuals. race_eth Factor. race/ethnicity individuals. edu Factor. education level individuals. occ_group Factor. occupation group individuals. univ Factor. Universe workers, whether denominator workers full-time . is_fulltime Logical. Whether individual full-time worker. NA distinction included. count Numeric. number individuals group. earn_q20 Numeric. 20th percentile earnings. earn_q25 Numeric. 25th percentile earnings. earn_q50 Numeric. 50th percentile (median) earnings. earn_q75 Numeric. 75th percentile earnings. earn_q80 Numeric. 80th percentile earnings. sample_n Numeric. sample size.

title: Median wages by demographic — wages
text: U.S. Census Bureau, American Community Survey, Integrated Public Use Microdata Series https://usa.ipums.org/usa/. Analyzed using srvyr package.

title: Median wages by demographic — wages
code: head(wages) #> # A tibble: 6 × 15 #>   dimension name     sex   race_eth edu   occ_group univ      is_fulltime  count #>   <fct>     <fct>    <fct> <fct>    <fct> <fct>     <fct>     <lgl>        <dbl> #> 1 total     US       Total Total    Total Total     All work… NA          1.49e8 #> 2 total     Maryland Total Total    Total Total     All work… NA          2.98e6 #> 3 sex       US       Men   Total    Total Total     Full-tim… TRUE        6.02e7 #> 4 sex       Maryland Men   Total    Total Total     Full-tim… TRUE        1.21e6 #> 5 sex       US       Men   Total    Total Total     All work… NA          7.89e7 #> 6 sex       Maryland Men   Total    Total Total     All work… NA          1.53e6 #> # ℹ 6 more variables: earn_q20 <dbl>, earn_q25 <dbl>, earn_q50 <dbl>, #> #   earn_q75 <dbl>, earn_q80 <dbl>, sample_n <dbl>

title: Median wages by PUMA — wages_by_puma
text: dataset containing median individual earnings sex Public Use Microdata Areas (PUMAs) US, adults ages 25 working full time positive earnings. data calculated 2022 American Community Survey (ACS) Public Use Microdata Sample (PUMS) data via Integrated Public Use Microdata Series (IPUMS). PUMAs areas least 100,000 people.

title: Median wages by PUMA — wages_by_puma
text: data frame 4702 rows 5 variables: statefip Character. state FIPS code. geoid Character. PUMA FIPS code. sex Character. sex individuals. count Numeric. number individuals. earn Numeric. median earnings.

title: Median wages by PUMA — wages_by_puma
text: U.S. Census Bureau, American Community Survey, Integrated Public Use Microdata Series https://usa.ipums.org/usa/. Analyzed using srvyr package.

what: Predictions of youth risks in Connecticut — youth_risks
title: Predictions of youth risks in Connecticut — youth_risks
text: dataset containing Likert-style responses questions different outcomes youth area, 2021 DataHaven Community Wellbeing Survey. data broken category, group, response values adults Connecticut.

title: Predictions of youth risks in Connecticut — youth_risks
Predictions of youth risks in Connecticut — youth_risks
text: data frame nrow(youth_risks) rows ncol(youth_risks) variables: code Character. code question. question Character. question predicted outcome youth. category Factor. category respondent (e.g., total, gender). group Factor. group respondent (e.g., Connecticut, male, female). response Factor. response question (almost certain, likely, toss , likely, likely). value Numeric. share respondents giving response.

title: Predictions of youth risks in Connecticut — youth_risks
text: DataHaven Community Wellbeing Survey 2021, analyzed Camille's packages cwi dcws (currently public). https://ctdatahaven.org/reports/datahaven-community-wellbeing-survey

title: Predictions of youth risks in Connecticut — youth_risks
code: head(youth_risks) #> # A tibble: 6 × 6 #>   code   question                  category group       response           value #>   <chr>  <chr>                     <fct>    <fct>       <fct>              <dbl> #> 1 LIFECA Graduate from high school Total    Connecticut Almost certain    0.392  #> 2 LIFECA Graduate from high school Total    Connecticut Very likely       0.546  #> 3 LIFECA Graduate from high school Total    Connecticut A toss up         0.0412 #> 4 LIFECA Graduate from high school Total    Connecticut Not very likely   0      #> 5 LIFECA Graduate from high school Total    Connecticut Not at all likely 0.0103 #> 6 LIFECA Graduate from high school Gender   Male        Almost certain    0.394
